DIALOGUE BEFORE: Tula: I am the rim. The spoke and hub support me.
RESPONSE TEXT: I am the rim. The spoke and hub support me.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DaraHubbell: We fought a great battle today.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DaraHubbell: Everyone gather! Form the wheel.
RESPONSE TEXT: I am the rim. The spoke and hub support me.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DaraHubbell: The time has come. The Hub's grand plan can enter its next, important phase.

RESPONSE TEXT: Dara is outside. You should really talk to her first.
Talk to me if you want an alignment.
I can just feel the neurodynes flooding your system. You really should get an alignment soon.
Don't fall too far behind.
Let me start up the zeta rays.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: Okay, locking onto the neurodynes.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: Let me start up the zeta rays.
RESPONSE TEXT: Okay, locking onto the neurodynes.
There are so many of them! What have you been doing?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: Good. The zeta rays are withering them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: Let me start up the zeta rays.
RESPONSE TEXT: Locking onto the neurodynes.
You seem to have gathered almost as many as I removed before.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: Good. The zeta rays are withering them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: Let me start up the zeta rays.
RESPONSE TEXT: Neurodynes are locked.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: Good. The zeta rays are withering them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: There are so many of them! What have you been doing?
RESPONSE TEXT: Good. The zeta rays are withering them.
Well, some of them at least.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: There are so many of them! What have you been doing?
RESPONSE TEXT: You really should be more careful about the company you keep.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: There are so many of them! What have you been doing?
RESPONSE TEXT: The zeta rays are destroying them.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: There are so many of them! What have you been doing?
RESPONSE TEXT: I like watching them squirm and die.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: There are so many of them! What have you been doing?
RESPONSE TEXT: These are more active than normal.
There they go. All gone now.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: There are so many of them! What have you been doing?
RESPONSE TEXT: 25 percent... 50 percent... 75 percent... gone.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: There are so many of them! What have you been doing?
RESPONSE TEXT: They're trying to hide. They know the end is near. There. Gone.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: Well, some of them at least.
RESPONSE TEXT: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: Congratulations! You are now an AHS-1.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: Well, some of them at least.
RESPONSE TEXT: The process is complete. You are doing quite well.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: Congratulations! You are now an AHS-1.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.
RESPONSE TEXT: Congratulations! You are now an AHS-1.
That stands for Aligned Hub Seeker. You have taken the first step in a long journey.
Here are your robes.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well done, AHS-2. Of course you'll need more treatments.
Neurodynes build up with exposure to infected people.
That's why we recommend only interacting with other hubologists.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.
RESPONSE TEXT: You are now officially an AHS-3. Congratulations!

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.
RESPONSE TEXT: A newly minted AHS-4. I remember when I made that rank.
Good times. Good times.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.
RESPONSE TEXT: You're doing quite well AHS-5. I've rarely seen anyone progress this quickly.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.
RESPONSE TEXT: AHS-6 is a rank with many responsibilities and privileges.
Someday Dara will let us know what they are.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Phil: And we're done. For now. You'll need many more treatments.
RESPONSE TEXT: You've made it to AHS-7! Very impressive.
I am also an AHS-7. Although by now I should be an AHS-8.
Dara is dragging her feet with my promotion.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: Back already AHS-6?
RESPONSE TEXT: I've told Dara that you are rising too quickly. Even Cleansed didn't promote this quickly.
He's been working for months to save enough caps for his next alignment.
But I'm sure you won't have any problems donating 5000 caps.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I am ready.
RESPONSE TEXT: Then please sit in the Zeta Aligner.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I am ready.
RESPONSE TEXT: This isn't enough. Come back when you have the caps.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No, not yet. I'll come back later.
RESPONSE TEXT: You risk undoing all of your hard work so far.
Just stay away from suppressors and don't wait too long for your next alignment.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: More caps? You're all a bunch of nutjobs if you think I'm paying that. I quit.
RESPONSE TEXT: You are no better than the other tainted minds. You are destined to be nothing but rim meat.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Can you tell me about The Hub's plan now?
RESPONSE TEXT: Now that you are AHS-6, you are ready.
The Hub persuaded the Star Father to let the true faithful live with him on the planet Quetzal.
We need to show our devotion by constantly fighting the influences of the neurodynes and suppressors.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Can you tell me about The Hub's plan now?
RESPONSE TEXT: In a spaceship of course.
The Star Father provided the co-ordinates of Quetzal to The Hub.
But it's up to us to provide the means. Our hard work shows our commitment to him and our worthiness to sit by his side.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No, not yet. I'll come back later.
RESPONSE TEXT: If you let it go on too long, the neurodynes will just build up in you mind, clouding your abilities.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Isn't the first one supposed to be free?
RESPONSE TEXT: I suppose I can do that.
Have a seat in the Zeta Aligner.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Isn't the first one supposed to be free?
RESPONSE TEXT: That would not show the proper commitment on your part.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What are neurodynes?
RESPONSE TEXT: Neurodynes build up in your brain, clouding your ability to think.
After an alignment, you will think more clearly and be happier.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What are neurodynes?
RESPONSE TEXT: You are strapped into the chair and your central nervous system is pumped full of zeta radiation.
This destroys some of the neurodynes. However, over time, they will build up again without further treatment.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: I cannot help you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Dara has said your treatment must wait until we have achieved our goal.
Once we have control of the junkyard you can receive another alignment.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: I cannot help you.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's taken me years to master the rank of AHS-7.
Yet Dara refuses to promote me. Me! Her most loyal follower.
But you. You come in here and she fawns all over you.
She's going to replace me, I know it. Go on. Go to Dara. Only she can promote you to AHS-8.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No, not yet. I'll come back later.
RESPONSE TEXT: You have just begun your journey toward enlightenment and true happiness.
Don't give up on it now. Come back soon.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I thought we were friends? You wouldn't charge a friend, would you?
RESPONSE TEXT: I suppose we are friends. Okay, but this is the last time.
Sit in the zeta aligner.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I thought we were friends? You wouldn't charge a friend, would you?
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm afraid I must insist.
You do want to free your mind and find greater happiness, don't you?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What exactly do neurodynes do?
RESPONSE TEXT: The human mind has unlimited potential.
But neurodynes prevent us from reaching it.
The zeta radiation we administer in an alignment will destroy some of them.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What exactly do neurodynes do?
RESPONSE TEXT: The spirits of the dead are constantly trying to influence us.
They reach into our brains and alter our chemistry to create neurodynes.
Zeta radiation destroys some of the neurodynes and drives the spirits away, but only for a short time.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: Are you ready to throw off the shackles of your neurodynes?
RESPONSE TEXT: Hubology takes commitment. A small donation of 50 caps shows your commitment to self-improvement.
You will take some rads during the procedure, so make sure you are healthy before starting.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: Our newest member. Welcome AHS-1. Are you ready to do battle with your neurodynes?
RESPONSE TEXT: We ask for a modest commitment of 100 caps for this alignment.
You'll take a bit more rads than last time, so make sure you are healthy before taking this alignment.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: You are doing well AHS-2. In your last alignment I saw unhealthy attachments to suppressors.
RESPONSE TEXT: Very difficult to treat. However, you'll only need to donate 250 caps.
Of course the rad dosage is a bit higher too.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No, not yet. I'll come back later.
RESPONSE TEXT: I worry about the influence of those suppressors. Don't wait too long.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What are suppressors?
RESPONSE TEXT: Those are the people in your life that are suppressing your talents and abilities.
They are riddled with neurodynes like you used to be.
Their brain waves can trigger excess neurodyne activity in you.
I strongly recommend you avoid them.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What are suppressors?
RESPONSE TEXT: Almost everyone in the Commonwealth is a suppressor, but some are worse than others.
Anyone that tried to convince you of the rightness of their cause is almost certainly a suppressor.
We usually recommend limiting your contact with people who are not hubologists.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: Welcome back AHS-3. It is time for a fresh alignment.
RESPONSE TEXT: We'll be treating more deeply rooted neurodynes. You'll need to donate 500 caps.
The radiation is also strong, so make sure your rads are low.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No, not yet. I'll come back later.
RESPONSE TEXT: You are only an AHS-3. You are still highly susceptible to suppressors. Please be careful out there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How many more alignments do I need?
RESPONSE TEXT: It's hard to say. Probably until The Hub's grand plan begins.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How many more alignments do I need?
RESPONSE TEXT: The details are restricted to AHS-6 and above.
But I can tell you that it will end the need for alignments. We will be forever protected from the neurodynes of malignant spirits.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: It's good to see you AHS-4. You are progressing quickly.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm sure the Star Father is impressed.
We need to probe deeper, and you will have to take more rads.
It will take a donation of 1000 caps for this alignment.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No, not yet. I'll come back later.
RESPONSE TEXT: You are doing so well! It breaks my heart to see you so close to true enlightenment only to be distracted. Come back soon.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Who is this Star Father?
RESPONSE TEXT: Our founder, The Hub, made contact with the Star Father long ago.
He lives on the distant planet Quetzal in the constellation of Zyphus.
He is the source of all enlightenment through the alignments he taught The Hub.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Who is this Star Father?
RESPONSE TEXT: The tools are manmade, but the process is a gift from the Star Father through his prophet, The Hub.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MaleEvenToned: Is it time for another alignment already AHS-5?
RESPONSE TEXT: You are about to be blessed by the Star Father.
Although if it were up to me, you would wait. You are rising too quickly.
This is an even deeper probe with even more rads than last time. A donation of 2500 caps will cover it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No, not yet. I'll come back later.
RESPONSE TEXT: If you must wait, wait here with us.
The outside world will bring you into contact with suppressive influences.
I'd hate to undo all the work we've accomplished so far.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Can you tell me more about the Star Father?
RESPONSE TEXT: He is the source of life on Earth. We are all his descendants.
But we have lost our way, led astray by the neurodynes.
But that will all end with The Hub's grand plan.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Can you tell me more about the Star Father?
RESPONSE TEXT: You are not ready for that mystery yet AHS-5. Maybe next time.
But rest assured, The Hub received guidance from the Star Father.
We all have a place in his grand plan.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I am ready.

RESPONSE TEXT: For the Hub!
The rim will grind you down!
The wheel will roll over you!
If you need an alignment, you know where to find me.
I cannot help you.
Are you ready to throw off the shackles of your neurodynes?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: Hubology takes commitment. A small donation of 50 caps shows your commitment to self-improvement.

RESPONSE TEXT: Our newest member. Welcome AHS-1. Are you ready to do battle with your neurodynes?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Phil: We ask for a modest commitment of 100 caps for this alignment.
